sen.j: 五色豆（ごしきまめ）は糖衣のいり豆に5色の色を付けたもので、京都の銘菓とされる。
sen.e: Goshiki-mame (five-colored roasted sweet beans), which are roasted beans of five different colors covered with sugar coating, is regarded as a well-known Kyoto confection.
Goshiki-mame (five-colored roasted sweet beans), roasted beans of five different colors covered with a sugar coating, are regarded as a well-known Kyoto confection.
Goshiki-mame (five-colored roasted sweet beans), roasted beans of five different colors covered with a sugar coating, are regarded as a well-known Kyoto confection.

sen.j: 豆をいり、砂糖の衣をかけたもので、色彩はおおむね次のとおりである。
sen.e: The beans are parched and coated with sugar, and their colors are usually as mentioned below:
The beans are parched and coated with sugar, and their colors are usually as mentioned below:
The beans are parched and coated with sugar, and their colors are usually as mentioned below:
White, yellow, red, brown and green.
White, yellow, red, brown and green.
White, yellow, red, brown and green.

sen.j: 商品の形状としては、上部が透明な箱に入れられ、5色の状態が見えるようにされたものが多い。
sen.e: They are often packed in boxes with the upper side covered with transparent materials to show the five different colors.
They are often packed in boxes with the upper side covered with transparent materials to show the five different colors.
They are often packed in boxes with the upper side covered with transparent materials to show the five different colors.
